books.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism. Read by the author. 10 hours, 43 minutes unabridged.
books.title: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST

books.author: James Nestor
books.description: A re-examination of a basic biological function and a look at the science behind ancient breathing practices. Read by the author. 7 hours, 18 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BREATH

books.author: John Bolton
books.description: The former national security advisor gives his account of working for President Trump. Read by Robert Petkoff. 20 hours, 52 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE ROOM WHERE IT HAPPENED

books.author: Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice. Read by the author. 8 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNTAMED

books.author: Ron Chernow
books.description: A biography of the first Treasury secretary and one of the Founding Fathers of the United States. The basis of the Tony Award-winning Broadway musical. Read by Scott Brick. 36 hours, 2 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ALEXANDER HAMILTON

books.author: Ben Shapiro
books.description: The conservative commentator describes what he perceives as threats to American ideals. Read by the author. 6 hours, 19 minutes unabridged.
books.title: HOW TO DESTROY AMERICA IN THREE EASY STEPS

books.author: Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent. Read by the author. 19 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BECOMING

books.author: Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts. Read by the author. 8 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: TALKING TO STRANGERS

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.” Read by the author. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BORN A CRIME

books.author: Michelle Alexander
books.description: A law professor on the “war on drugs” and its role in the disproportionate incarceration of Black men. Read by Karen Chilton. 16 hours, 57 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE NEW JIM CROW

books.author: Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university. Read by Julia Whelan. 12 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EDUCATED

books.author: Eddie S Glaude Jr
books.description: An appraisal of the life and work of James Baldwin and their meaning in relation to the Black Lives Matter movement and the Trump presidency. Read by the author. 7 hours, 44 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BEGIN AGAIN

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.

books.title: THE ADVENTURE ZONE: PETALS TO THE METAL

books.author: Jerry Craft
books.description: Jordan Banks, an artistically inclined seventh grader from Washington Heights, has a tough time navigating an upscale private school where diversity is low and maintaining his neighborhood friendships.

books.description: Raina finds her tummy trouble might be more than it first appears to be when she goes back to school.
